data.question: What is the formula of the fluorous metal-organic framework mentioned in the text?
What gas shows a hysteretic adsorption/desorption behavior in FMOF-1?
What is the volumetric capacity of hydrogen within FMOF-1 at 77 K and 64 bar?
Does FMOF-1 exhibit higher adsorptions for O2 and N2 at 77 K even at very low pressures?
Is the volumetric gas uptake of FMOF-1 the highest yet reported for O2?
Can the adsorption densities for O2 and N2 in FMOF-1 at very low pressure suggest that the gas is highly compressed within the pores?
What is the expected application of fluorous coordination polymers like FMOF-1?
data.answer: Gas storage and separation, catalysis, sensors, switches, actuators, and n-type field-effect transistors.

data.question: What is the structural feature of FMOF-1 that contributes to its high gas adsorption capacity?
data.answer: Extended 3D nanotubular open frameworks consisting of six-connected tetranuclear [Ag4Tz6] clusters linked by three-coordinate Ag(I) centers.

data.question: Is the adsorption isotherm of H2 within FMOF-1 reproducible?
Was FMOF-1 obtained by reacting Ag(I) with 3,5-bis(trifluoromethyl)-1,2,4-triazolate?
What is the topology of the 3D framework of FMOF-1?
What is the role of the CF3 groups in the structure of FMOF-1?
data.answer: They point into the channels, contributing to the hydrophobic internal cavities.

data.question: Does FMOF-1 maintain its crystallinity after evacuating the crystals by heating at 100 °C under vacuum overnight?
What is the unit cell volume percentage accounted for by the fluoro-lined channels in FMOF-1?
What is the apparent surface area of FMOF-1 as determined by fitting the BET equation to the N2 isotherm?
Is the volumetric capacity of hydrogen within FMOF-1 close to the DOE 2010 target?
What is the significance of the hysteretic adsorption/desorption of H2 within FMOF-1?
data.answer: It allows H2 to be adsorbed at high pressures but stored at lower pressures.

data.question: What is the activation procedure for FMOF-1 prior to gas adsorption studies?
data.answer: Heating at 60 °C under vacuum for 1 hr.

data.question: Does FMOF-1 show a two-step filling profile for hydrogen-adsorption isotherm at low pressure?
What is the role of fluorination in the properties of FMOFs compared to their non-fluorous counterparts?
data.answer: Expected to possess enhanced thermal stability, catalytic activity, higher gas affinity and selectivity, and higher stability to oxidation and light.
